intro: Pedicularis lutescens var. longipetiolata, commonly known as the long petioled yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and long, slender leaf petioles, which distinguish it from other varieties. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats where it can receive adequate sunlight. Its botanical features make it a notable species for botanists and horticulturists interested in rare alpine flora.
